guide.introduction: First I will show you how to make the enclosure, and route the wires. Then I will show you how to hook up the Servo & Arduino.
guide.introduction_rendered:
First I will show you how to make the enclosure, and route the wires. Then I will show you how to hook up the Servo & Arduino.

Relevant parts
  • Conduit
  • Flexible Tubing
  • Micro Servo 9g
  • Project Enclosure (5x2.5x2")
  • Project wire
  • Slide Door Lock
Tools
  • Drill and drill bits
  • Nibbler tool

parts.notes: I used a Plastic, Self-Adhesive type.
Make sure it fits snug in the end of the conduit.
Look in the pictures, I'm not sure what the actual name of them are.

lines.text: Using a Drill & Nibbler Tool, make a square hole in the Project Enclosure as shown in the picture (In the red box).
lines.text_raw: Using a Drill & Nibbler Tool, make a square hole in the Project Enclosure as shown in the picture (In the red box).

lines.text: You want it big enough so the sliding lock has enough room to move freely all the way into the project enclosure.
lines.text_raw: You want it big enough so the sliding lock has enough room to move freely all the way into the project enclosure.

lines.text: Next, Drill a hole just big enough for the wires to go through (All 3 of them).
lines.text_raw: Next, Drill a hole just big enough for the wires to go through (All 3 of them).

lines.text: You want this hole to be as close to the door as possible, so the conduit will line up with it.
lines.text_raw: You want this hole to be as close to the door as possible, so the conduit will line up with it.

lines.text: Don't make the mistake I did and drill the hole in the wrong end! The hole should go on the end that is INSIDE the enclosure.
lines.text_raw: Don't make the mistake I did and drill the hole in the wrong end! The hole should go on the end that is INSIDE the enclosure.

lines.text: Drill a small hole through the end of the slide lock as shown.
lines.text_raw: Drill a small hole through the end of the slide lock as shown.

lines.text: Try to get the hole as close to the end as possible!
lines.text_raw: Try to get the hole as close to the end as possible!

lines.text: This is important because it needs that extra room to slide.
lines.text_raw: This is important because it needs that extra room to slide.

lines.text: Drill a hole in the servo gear just big enough for the wire to go through (Blue Circle in the picture).
lines.text_raw: Drill a hole in the servo gear just big enough for the wire to go through (Blue Circle in the picture).

lines.text: Mount the Servo inside the project box, and attach a strong wire (Coat Hanger?) to the servo and slide lock as shown in the picture.
lines.text_raw: Mount the Servo inside the project box, and attach a strong wire (Coat Hanger?) to the servo and slide lock as shown in the picture.

lines.text: Don't Permanently mount it until you can test it out. (Alignment is the key)
lines.text_raw: Don't Permanently mount it until you can test it out. (Alignment is the key)

lines.text: You can use a small dab of hot glue to mount it if you have nothing else.
lines.text_raw: You can use a small dab of hot glue to mount it if you have nothing else.

lines.text: Using Project Wire, attach very long lengths of wire to the wires on the servo. (Be sure to connect all 3).
lines.text_raw: Using Project Wire, attach very long lengths of wire to the wires on the servo. (Be sure to connect all 3).

lines.text: Run the wires through the small hole in the project box that we drilled in step 1.
lines.text_raw: Run the wires through the small hole in the project box that we drilled in step 1.

lines.text: Run a piece of conduit on the door itself, from the project box to the other end of the door.
lines.text_raw: Run a piece of conduit on the door itself, from the project box to the other end of the door.

lines.text: Next, Run the 3 wires through the conduit.
lines.text_raw: Next, Run the 3 wires through the conduit.

lines.text: Leave about 2" of space between the end of the conduit and the edge of the door.
lines.text_raw: Leave about 2" of space between the end of the conduit and the edge of the door.

lines.text: Be sure to align the conduit to the hole we drill in the project box.
lines.text_raw: Be sure to align the conduit to the hole we drill in the project box.

lines.text: Run the rest of the conduit along the "outside" of the door.
lines.text_raw: Run the rest of the conduit along the "outside" of the door.

lines.text: Now we're going to run the wires through the flexible tubing as shown.
lines.text_raw: Now we're going to run the wires through the flexible tubing as shown.

lines.text: Next, slide the flexible tubing inside the ends of the Conduit as shown in the picture.
lines.text_raw: Next, slide the flexible tubing inside the ends of the Conduit as shown in the picture.

lines.text: You can use hot glue to hold the tubing inside the conduit if needed.
lines.text_raw: You can use hot glue to hold the tubing inside the conduit if needed.

lines.text: What this tubing does, is allows the wires to flex when the door is opened and closed.
lines.text_raw: What this tubing does, is allows the wires to flex when the door is opened and closed.

lines.text: Now that we have the conduit and wires all run, and the servo is attached the slide lock, we can hook up the wires!
lines.text_raw: Now that we have the conduit and wires all run, and the servo is attached the slide lock, we can hook up the wires!

lines.text: Attach the Power wire on the servo to the +5v on the Arduino.
lines.text_raw: Attach the Power wire on the servo to the +5v on the Arduino.

lines.text: Attach the Ground wire from the servo to the GND on the Arduino.
lines.text_raw: Attach the Ground wire from the servo to the GND on the Arduino.

lines.text: Attach the Signal wire from the Servo to Digital Pin 12.
lines.text_raw: Attach the Signal wire from the Servo to Digital Pin 12.

lines.text: Test it out using the Example on Arduino IDE called "Sweep".
lines.text_raw: Test it out using the Example on Arduino IDE called "Sweep".

lines.text: You may have to adjust the alignment a bit to get it working right.
lines.text_raw: You may have to adjust the alignment a bit to get it working right.

lines.text: If all is working well, place the cover on the enclosure, and job well done!
lines.text_raw: If all is working well, place the cover on the enclosure, and job well done!

guide.summary: Here we are going to make a Automatic Door Lock/Unlock for your home/office. We will use a Servo, connected to a Lock by a wire.  It will be controlled with a Arduino.
guide.title: Automatic Door Lock/Unlock (For Home/Office)
